sponsor.partnerMessage: Emcar Stone Studio is now serving NWA! They are a family owned and operated full service fabrication and installation company that specializes in quartz, granite, marble, and quartzite countertops. Contact them today for a complimentary quote!

posts.title: A Hidden Gem
posts.content:
In NWA, we're fortunate to have great Mexican food of many different varieties on seemingly every corner, and everyone has their go-to spot. We recently took a visit to La Media Luna, and if it's not on your list, it should be!

  • What's cookin?: La Media Luna adds a unique, gourmet flair to traditional Mexican dishes that is unlike anything else in Northwest Arkansas. The crowd favorites are the Cochinita Pibil and the Chile En Nogada, and they are a must.
  • Great food, better company: The staff at La Media Luna is incredibly friendly and loves to make sure guests have a great time. The restaurant hosts a Mariachi band on Friday nights and Jazz music on Thursday and Saturday nights. In the summer, you can enjoy this music out on a fun patio.

If you're more of a taco Tuesday person, the restaurant offers great happy hour options from 4-6p on weeknights. Get more details and read their story here.

posts.title: The Jones Center To Host Indoor Triathlon And Training Challenge
posts.content:
The Jones Center is hosting a Triathlon Training Challenge for its indoor triathlon in March. 

  • Get ready: The Jones Center Indoor Triathlon, a spin cycling, swimming, and running event, will occur on Saturday, March 12. The training challenge begins on Jan. 31 and provides participants 6 weeks to train and prepare. 
  • Get set: Registration for the training challenge includes registration for the indoor triathlon, a t-shirt for the event, and access to the Jones Center pool, fitness center, and spin classes leading up to the event. 

Find more information and register HERE.

posts.title: U of A Libraries Receives $5.1m In Gifts
posts.content:
The University of Arkansas Libraries recently received more than $5m from individuals as gifts to create new opportunities for students and faculty. 

  • Improvements: Most of the contributions will establish 2 endowed faculty positions, a Dean’s Chair and a Professorship in Special Collections. Part of the funds will go toward renovations of the Mullins Library. 
  • Amplified: The gifts are from anonymous graduates of the U of A, and their combined contribution is the largest given to the University Libraries to date. The new endowed positions will be the first for the University Libraries and will enable amplification of the Special Collections Division.

Click HERE for more details.

posts.title: Local Lettuce And Herbs Available For Pick-Up
posts.content:
Living in the Ozarks comes with its perks as fresh, leafy greens are available to pick up from your local farm in Rogers. 

  • Come n' get it: The lettuce and herbs at Ozark Fresh Living Greens (OFLG) are fed exactly what they need to be “the best dense lettuce you have ever tasted” without harmful pesticides and herbicides. You can order your lettuce and herbs on the OFLG website and pick them up at the farm. 
  • Just water: The lettuce and herbs grow with the hydroponic method, which means the plants are grown with water and neutral nutrients — no soil. The farm is an 8,000 sq/ft greenhouse and can grow as much as could in a 10-acre soil farm. 

Find more information and order HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Date idea: This map of murals could make for a lovely stroll.
  • Jammin': Check out KUAF's latest Lunch Hour session.
  • Look and see: Traveling exhibit Women to Watch: Paper Routes is at Fenix Arts in Fayetteville.
  • Going east: The Razorback Foundation is expanding its grounds.
  • On video: If you missed the Fayetteville parking deck groundbreaking, never fear.
  • Tell it: Let's share your story together. Ask us about our advertising deals.
